page.title: 01BROCKHAM BONFIRE
page.content: The Brockham Bonfire is held every year on the nearest Saturday to November the 5th.The proceeds go to local charities and the Bonfire Committee.A lot of hard work goes into the making of the Bonfire and all work is done voluntarily.The Bonfire Committee usually start to build it about two months before Nov 5th and it is said to be the second biggest of its kind in Britain.It is a fun occasion and a treat for everyone.The Committee usually spend about Â£1000 on the fireworks.The fireworks used to be held near the bonfire on the village green but that has been considered too dangerous so they are now lit in a nearby field to view from the sky. There is also a band which starts playing at Strood Green and at 7.45 it arrives at the green where torches from the procession light the bonfire.
